owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Axe is a kind of weapon favoured by the Dwarves and few Elves.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Axe

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Bow is a long-range weapon usually, but not exclusively, made of wood that shoots arrows.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Bow

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Fictional characters, divided into various races, created by J. R.R. Tolkien.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Character

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: One of the races of fictional characters populating Middle Earth.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Dwarf

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: One of the races of fictional characters populating Middle Earth.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Elf

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The least common of Hobbits.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Fallohide

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The most common type of Hobbit.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Harfoot

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: One of the races of fictional characters populating Middle Earth.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Hobbit

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: One of the races of fictional characters populating Middle Earth.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Human

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Many different languages are spoken by the characters living in Middle-Earth.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Language

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: One of the races of fictional characters populating Middle Earth.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Maiar

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Names, in Tolkien's universe, are very important. As a matter of fact, the writer carefully thought about the meaning and the etimology of the names he created.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Name

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Subclass of Elf. Noldor are High Elves of the Second Clan who migrated to Valinor and lived in Eldamar.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Noldor

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: In Tolkien's universe, many places are created and taken into consideration.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Place

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: In Middle-Earth, rings are artefacts which possess magical powers.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Ring

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Usually used by the Maiars accompained by a sword
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Staff

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A type of Hobbit who lived in swampy areas.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Stoor

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Sublcass of Elf. Teleri were the third of the Elf clans who came to Aman.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Teleri

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Subclass of Elf. They are the fairest and most noble of the High Elves.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Vanyar

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Characters are provided with a weapon which they use to perform actions.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Weapon

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Andúril was the name for the sword Narsil after its reforging in Third Age 3018 for Aragorn, the heir of Isildur.

owl:NamedIndividual.means: eating between meals, the end of a bag

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: The Black Speech was created by Sauron during the Dark Years to be the sole language of all the servants of Mordor, replacing the many different varieties of Orkish and other languages used by his servants.
A broadaxe is a large-(broad) headed axe.

The Daggers of Westernesse were weapons that Tom Bombadil brought out of the mound in which Frodo Baggins and his friends had been imprisoned. Each dagger had a long, leaf-shaped blade, damasked with serpent-forms in red and gold. They had black sheaths of an unknown metal, light and strong, adorned with fiery stones.

Erebor was a mountain in the north-east of Rhovanion. It was the source of the river Running, and a major Dwarven stronghold, the Kingdom under the Mountain at the end of the Third Age and well into the Fourth.
Glamdring was a sword, said to have belonged to Turgon, but best known as the weapon of Gandalf during the War of the Ring. It was known in Westron as the Foe-hammer, and Orcs knew it as Beater.
Gondor was the South Kingdom of the Númenóreans in Middle-earth, established soon after the downfall of Númenor by Isildur and his brother Anárion.
Khuzdul, or Dwarvish, was the secret language of the Dwarves.

Mordor was a land in the south-east of the Westlands east of Gondor. During most of the Second and Third Ages it was ruled by Sauron and it was his dwelling and base from which he attempted to conquer Middle-earth. Mordor was surrounded by three enormous mountain ridges from the North, from the West and from the South, protecting it from an unexpected invasion by any of the Free peoples.
Narya was one of the Rings of Power, specifically one of the "Three Rings for the Elven Kings under the sky".
Quenya was one of the languages spoken by the Elves. It was the tongue that developed among those non-Telerin Elves who reached Aman (the High Elves) from an earlier language called Common Eldarin.
Sindarin was the Elvish language most commonly spoken in Middle-earth in the Third Age.
Sting was an Elvish knife that was probably made in Gondolin in the First Age. Its maker and original bearer are unknown.
The One Ring was an ancient artefact created by the Dark Lord Sauron in the Second Age for the purpose of ruling over the Free peoples of Middle-earth, mainly the Elves.
The Shire was a region in Eriador inhabited by Hobbits.
The Westron was the language of the Dúnedain of Middle-earth. By the end of the Third Age it was more or less a universal language spoken throughout the Westlands.
A Wizard Staff is the primary tool, power conduit, and sometimes weapon of Wizards, which might have also served as a symbol of their power or rank.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Staff

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: The Woodland Realm was a kingdom of Silvan Elves in Mirkwood, from the Second Age onwards.

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: In Middle-Earth, swords are forged out different materials and they might have secret hidden powers according to the hand that is using them.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Sword
